attributes.action: Regulate supported housing and hostels.
attributes.background: We need a regulatory body to license and oversee hostels and supported housing, including checking that support workers are trained, checking that licence agreements are fair, and offering a fair and impartial complaints procedure. Currently, owners get away with treating vulnerable adults unfairly.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people can find it difficult to understand their rights and make complaints. Proper regulation would mean that vulnerable people would be protected without having to fight to be treated fairly. I have been discriminated against and there was nothing I could do about it. A housing charity evicted me for not engaging enough, even though I have a severe anxiety disorder and another didn't deal with a complaint fairly and wasn't impartial.

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all non-recyclable plastics in the UK by 2025
attributes.background:
Plastic is a direct threat to the long term survival of all species, with the amount of plastic pollution in the oceans and land expanding at a catastrophic rate.
HM Government's strategy on plastic waste is inadequate in its current form and must be reviewed to ban all harmful plastics by 2025.

attributes.action: Make those with registered assistance dogs automatically eligible for PIP.
attributes.background: According to the Governments own website PIP should be paid to those who are financially penalised because of there disability or long term illness. Many people with assistance dogs actually get turned down for PIP because of the dog and the help they give, this is not right and needs to change.

attributes.action: Remove Widows Parents Allowance as an income on Universal Credit Claims
attributes.background: Universal Credit claims currently see Widows Parents Allowance as an income. Therefore any claim made by a widow is penalised resulting in the total amount of Widows Parents Allowance being deducted from their claim resulting in a far lesser payment of Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Widows Parents Allowance is exactly that, an allowance to help a widowed parent support and provide for their young children following the loss of the child's/children's parent.
I alone will not be able to make changes to the Universal Credit criteria, but feel strongly that the inclusion of Widows Parents Allowance in any Universal Credit claim should be reconsidered. Support should be given by our Government to those trying to better themselves following the devastating loss of a husband/wife

attributes.action: Provide help for residents of Tawergha in Libya
attributes.background: There are around 35,000 people (who are an ethnic minority) who have been forced to leave their homes in the 2011 revolution by militias from Misrata. The UN-backed Tripoli Government promised their return to Tawargha on the 1st of February 2018, after 7 years of living in bad conditions.
attributes.additional_details: The militias have refused this government decision and blocked the roads to Tawergha by force. Now the people of Tawergha have built make-shift camps in Gararat Al-Gadaf which is near Bin Walid and Harawa which is near Sirte. On 5/02/2018 militias from Mistrata attacked the camp and burned some tents. On 12/02/2018 two people passed away and some children were admitted to Bin Walid hospital due to exposure to the cold. I am asking the British Government to provide assistance to these civilians.

attributes.action: Set a legal maximum stake of £2 for fixed odds betting machines (FOBTS)
attributes.background:
Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this

B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds. There should be a legal maximum stake of £2 to protect people who are addicted to gambling.
attributes.additional_details:
Betting can be fun, but addiction isn't.
 
When the fun stops, stop. The fun has stopped - there are over 400,000 problem gamblers, with more than 2 million 'at risk' - so stop the FOBTs.
 
A £2 maximum stake (as already is in place on b3 games/ 'slots') would still allow serious, but stable gamblers to  win big, but not on the 'crack-cocaine' of gambling. 

We call on the Government to take this action to protect vulnerable people and to fix the problem in gambling.

attributes.action: Mandatory professional assessments for mental health decisions in organisations
attributes.background: Studying and working in the the field of mental health, I have seen both loved ones and service users lose out on employment opportunities and even be removed from positions due to misunderstanding and lay person judgement of their condition. This should not happen, and doesn't for other disability.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst it is currently possible to argue a duty of care motive for treating those with a diagnosed mental health condition differently; whether this is the case should be reviewed by a mental health professional. Otherwise, limitations placed on an individual can constitute disability discrimination. This is not currently mandatory, with occupational health doing this job if anyone. This is more true in voluntary organisations where loss of role is not termination of employment.

attributes.action: Make Staffordshire Bull terriers wear a harness or muzzle in public.
attributes.background:
My pet cat was savaged and killed by a Staffordshire bull terrier whilst the incompetent owner and his partner walked past my premises. 
The dog was not muzzled or in a harness, he was able to slip his lead and collar. The owner who had one arm in a sling at the time was unable to control him.
attributes.additional_details:
I am partially disabled and Ben is my only companion, this has had a devastating effect on my life. 
I reported the incident to the police and the Basildon Echo. 
The police are unable to do anything about it without identifying the owner. 
I have searched the neighbourhood and spoken with many local people but have been unable to find the owner. 
My MP encouraged me to start the petition and has spoken with the police on my behalf.

attributes.action: Debate the United Kingdom's recognition of Kosovo as an Independent Country.
attributes.background: I believe Kosovo was wrongly recognised as an independent country by the United Kingdom. The bombing campaign conducted by NATO in 1999 and Kosovo's separation in 2008, were unjust acts upon Serbia. This should be debated in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom wrongly recognised Kosovo's unilateral declaration of independence a day after it was declared on the 17th of February 2008. The unjust settlement was introduced without the agreement of both parties and a binding Security Council resolution. Serbia’s sovereignty was thus undermined and disrespected in the process. Therefore, the declaration of independence by Kosovo can be argued to be an unlawful secession and needs to be debated in parliament once more.

attributes.action: The UK Government to support a joint British bid for the 2030 world cup
attributes.background: Britain has shown itself to be a nation that unites when it comes to sport. In these somewhat divided times a post-Brexit United Kingdom will need to find ways to unite us all and demonstrate that we are outward facing nation. What better way that a joint bid to host the football World Cup?
attributes.additional_details: The English FA mounted an unsuccessful bid to host the recent 2018 World Cup that was awarded to Russia. Whilst there is no doubt that England has the footballing infrastructure to host the tournament the world cup has of course been held in England once before in 1966 and a joint British bid would be something new with the added dimensions of all home nations then qualifying as hosts. As well as Wembley and other English stadia games could be played at Principality and Hampden Park.

attributes.action: British National (Overseas) Citizens should be given full British Citizenship.
attributes.background: People in Hong Kong who hold the British National (Overseas) passport are British; however, the British government is refusing and avoiding giving these Hong Kongers the right of abode in the United Kingdom nor in any of the British territories. Many of them were forced to become PROC Chinese.
attributes.additional_details: The Chinese government is ignoring the Sino Anglo Agreements signed in 1981. It could be a disaster if we keep ignoring this is happening. Hong Kongers will come in as political refugees. We will need a lot of effort to house them and bad for the British reputations to the International community then.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single-use, portable BBQs
attributes.background: Disposable single-use BBQs encourage people into the countryside during good weather but recent coverage of large scale moorland fires this year illustrates their incompatibility with responsible countryside use. Using BBQ in hot, dry weather is simply not worth the risk to nature, property or life.
attributes.additional_details: This summer's significant national media coverage of moorland wildfires across the UK

attributes.action: Provide special constables with a right to time off work to undertake duties
attributes.background: There is no right to unpaid time off work to undertake duties as a special constable.  Other public duties benefit from this right such as magistrates and council members. Special constables patrol side by side with paid police officers undertaking the same duties and tasks but on a voluntary basis.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 50(1) of the Employment Rights Act 1996 provides:

"An employer shall permit an employee of his who is a justice of the peace to take time off during the employee’s working hours for the purpose of performing any of the duties of his office."

The petitioner proposes a simple amendment to the Act:  after "justice of the peace" insert "or a special constable".  This would provide recognition to thousands of special constables in the country, providing them with the right to undertake their duties.

attributes.action: To include adult grooming in the Sexual Offences Act 2003.
attributes.background:
Age is arbitrary and anyone can be groomed. 

This could mean an elderly person, someone with a mental health condition or just someone who has their guard down. 

Let's change the legislation to help these victims and stop these heinous acts from continuing.
attributes.additional_details:
'Grooming can be defined as the process that an abuser uses to desensitise someone – to make them less like to reject or report abusive behaviour.'

https://www.survivorsuk.org/question/grooming/

Also use the site for further information.

attributes.action: Award ten bank holiday's to England/Wales.
attributes.background:
England/Wales get 8 bank holidays, Scotland get 9 and Northern Ireland get 10.

The government should take into consideration that we need more bank holidays in order to have more personal and family time as we have the right to a private and family life and more bank holidays will help with this!

attributes.action: Licence possession of all knives that have potential to harm.
attributes.background: Our licensing laws forbid guns in our drawers, so why can't our government push for a change? License the manufacturing and possession of potential weapons. Rounded edge knives only unless licensed.

attributes.action: Make law to link all new vehicles' EMS to their Sat-Nav, to limit their speed.
attributes.background:
Vehicular Sat-Nav systems already receive data relating to the speed limit of a vehicle's location, and should be connected to each one's EMS, so it can automatically limit its speed.
• Emergency vehicles would be exempt (for obvious reasons)
• A criminal offence to circumvent the technology
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UK suffered 3,064 accidents attributable to speed, in which people were either killed or seriously injured. The technology now exists that can make the roads safer.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of any further unelected peers
attributes.background: The Prime Minister is attempting to create 10 new peers to help ensure the government does not get defeated in the House of Lords. This is an abuse of the system. I suggest we create no further peers and start to vote them in. This way we can transition to an elected second house and stop cronyism.
attributes.additional_details: The existing peers will retain their positions but as the resign/die their seat will then be up for election.

attributes.action: Create a register of people banned from keeping animals in the UK
attributes.background: Bans on keeping animals are currently unenforcible as no national register exists. This petition argues that a national register should be created listing all individuals who have been convicted of animal cruelty and banned from keeping animals.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see a government website created that breeders and pet shops can use to search a database of people banned from keeping animals this is the only way we  can stop these convicted people from purchasing and possibly neglecting another  animal!

attributes.action: Introduce a national agency to perform detailed 'anti-money laundering' testing
attributes.background:
Anti money laundering (AML) checks are required by banks, and also legal advisers, accountants etc
Given a desire to reduce the UK as a destination for 'dirty money' rules could be tighter
AML checks are hard to carry out meaningfully and are already time consuming
attributes.additional_details:
A single agency could improve on the status quo by:
- removing duplication
- unbiased approach
- removing competitive pressures to cut rigour ('all our other [x] accepted this, why don't you?')
- speeding up transactions by pre-approval
- ability to see full picture of all UK investments when testing source of funds

Scheme could be self-funding by charging fees

Data security:
- replace info being gathered and held by multiple parties
- no need to disclose full details when issuing certificate

attributes.action: Ensure the Windrush generation can exercise their right to vote.
attributes.background: People affected by the Windrush debacle have had every right that UK citizens take for granted, including the right to vote. Now that the citizenship issue is being resolved, it is only right and proper to ensure they can exercise their right to vote.

attributes.action: Non transitioned transgender* members of military serve as identified gender
attributes.background: Currently, transgender people must have completed transition to be treated as the gender they identify with. It takes years and years to fully transition, meaning some people may have their dreams of joining the British military destroyed. We should allow people to serve as who they are.
attributes.additional_details: Our country prides itself on tolerance and acceptance of all people, regardless of their sex, race, sexual orientation, religion, but why in the British military do we not accept them for their gender (change). Being treated as someone who you are not can make you feel extremely uncomfortable, dysphoric and could even lead to mental health issues. The UK army has recently had a "This is belonging" campaign, but why don't trans* people belong in their identified gender? Please change this

attributes.action: Please remove age restriction in s3(5) of the British Nationality Act
attributes.background: Our son was denied an application to register as a British citizen because he had just turned 18, and informed by Home Office that his only path to citizenship was settlement / ILR (£2389 + Life in UK test £50) followed by naturalisation (£1330 + £20 for biometrics + £80 citizenship ceremony).
attributes.additional_details: Please remove the age restriction to register as a British citizen in section 3(5) birth abroad to parents who are British by descent but now domiciled in UK. Why does the entitlement under British Nationality law end upon reaching the age of 18? Article 8 / Human Rights Act 1998 and UN Declaration on Human Rights state inter alia "The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State."

attributes.action: All local authorities should recycle all plastic
attributes.background: Torridge and West Devon do not currently allow recycling of anything other than plastic bottles. All other plastic is sent to landfill. In a joined up world how can it be that other Councils can recycle all plastic and others can only recycle some.
attributes.additional_details: Surely we should have a joined up approach to recycling ALL waste, particularly all plastic. Each council should adhere to a national recycling standard where all plastic is sent to be recycled. Economies of scale would make this more feasible rather than individual councils negotiating their own recycling schemes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cyclists to overtake on the nearside of traffic
attributes.background:
There have recently been several cyclist deaths due to traffic turning left and not seeing the cyclist. This is a preventable by stopping cyclists from coming up the nearside of vehicles.
Stopping this behaviour will save lives.

attributes.action: Allow on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights.
attributes.background: Allowing on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights would make them more noticeable to other vehicles. This would help minimise delays while they are trying to get to their respective station. Delays cost lives!
attributes.additional_details: Green flashing lights can currently be used by doctors. These lights don't give any exemption to traffic laws, but do highlight the importance of the journey. This means that vehicles are more likely to let them past than if they had no lighting.

attributes.action: Hold a snap election in response to Theresa May's poor leadership over Syria.
attributes.background: Theresa May's decision to approve air strikes in Syria without consulting the British parliament should not go unchallenged. Her lack of consideration has called the safety of this country into question and put innocent lives of the Syrian people in danger.

attributes.action: Record homeless death statistics at local and national levels
attributes.background: According to the guardian, the number of homeless deaths on Britain’s streets has more than doubled since 2013, yet the extent of the problem is not known as neither the government nor local authorities are required to keep statistics on this. By understanding the problem, it can be better tackled.
attributes.additional_details: On 11 April 2018, Patrick Greenfield and Sarah Marsh wrote in the guardian that the number of homeless people dying on the streets of Britain has more than doubled in recent years, but the true extent of the problem could be much higher as there is no national or locally recorded official statistics measuring this. To better understand and help to tackle this issue, statistics on the number of deaths of homeless people on the streets of Britain should be recorded.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence not to report child abuse
attributes.background: If children report abuse to an adult, including a family member, that adult must be required by law to report it to the police. Too many families choose to keep quiet to protect their (family) honour and/ or careers and let the defenceless child suffer.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for security staff to have a body-worn camera.
attributes.background: Due to the nature of some security staff otherwise known as 'bouncers', it has become clear to me that a body worn camera is needed for the safety and security of both parties.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone who has been to an event of some kind knows of one or more stories of something going wrong when trying to get into the event. If evidence such as video can be reviewed then a better outcome can come of the incident.

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: Write off all the student loans up to the current academic year.
attributes.background:
All student loans are mis-sold. The main reasons are:
Lack of information provided at the time of agreement i.e. interest rates and the term of the loan.
No information or support provided during the term of the loan.
No communication provided after the course ended on how much is owed.
attributes.additional_details:
Student loans have been a huge scam, pulling in students by millions and selling them an idea of a cheap loan. All the loans should be written off, new regulations and guidelines should put into place from next academic year so students know what they are getting themselves into.There is a serious breach of duty of care which the government owes to us all as the loans are provided by the government.
https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/jun/04/student-loans-really-were-mis-sold

attributes.action: Changes required under the Universal Credit to support workers!
attributes.background:
make uploading documentation for childcare costs or any other evidence available online - this will enable working families to upload in a timely manner!

monies to be paid in advance for childcare costs as ALL nurseries UK wide require advance payment!!
attributes.additional_details: I am a single mother to 2 under 3's who works as a manager but is newly single and having to rely on a system whether the childcare costs and housing costs have not been paid for the last 2 months leaving me in a very difficult situation that nobody else (IN WORK) SHOULD GO THROUGH!

attributes.action: Stop introducing fixed tenancies to tenants
attributes.background: New legislation is putting forward that fixed term tenancies will be given to everyone who is signing a new tenancy. This means tenants with existing secure tenancies will loose their secure tenancy example through mutual exchange and through the bidding system.
attributes.additional_details: Tenants are given opportunity to move through mutual exchange and being forced to give up their secure tenancy because they need extra space or to downsize. Now it’s a choice of quality of living or a secure tenancy. With these new laws coming in no one is secure people with vulnerability should be excempt from these laws. It would be better that those who need to move through mutual exchange should keep their existing tenancy status ie secure tenancy and move that over to the swapper property.

attributes.action: Re-run the appointments process for the board of the Office for Students
attributes.background: The Commissioner for Public Appointments has identified serious governance failings and political interference in the appointment of board members of the new Office for Students. All board members should be asked to immediately resign and the appointments process be re-run in  proper manner.
attributes.additional_details: The full report of the Commissioner can be accessed here: https://publicappointmentscommissioner.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Commissioner-for-Public-Appointments-Investigation-OFS-Final-.pdf

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Have a UK passport only channel in U.K. airports.
attributes.background:
Every time I fly throughout the year I am constantly in a huge queue to enter my home country!
It is so frustrating to have a UK/EU passport channel where 75% of the people are not UK citizens. We are one of the only countries where our own citizens queue to come HOME.
attributes.additional_details:
We shouldn’t have to be in a long queue where most of those are EU not U.K. citizens. Priority should be given to British passport holders just as every other country does by having U.K. passport ONLY lanes too.
Even the queues for non EU/UK passports is often smaller and quicker and it’s really a kick in the teeth to queue when in other counties airports at the border and then also at the border when you get home!

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: Make sending sexual photo/film with or WITHOUT intent to cause distress illegal
attributes.background:
Section 33 of Criminal Justice and Court Act 2015
1)It is an offence for a person to disclose a private sexual photograph or film if the disclosure is made
(a)without the consent of an individual who appears in the photograph or film, and
(b)with the intention of causing that individual distress.
attributes.additional_details:
In section (8) the law says: "A person charged with an offence under this section is not to be taken to have disclosed a photograph or film with the intention of causing distress merely because that was a natural and probable consequence of the disclosure"

This law creates a loophole for criminals who did not consider their victim's reaction or the probable consequences of disclosure. The law needs to be reworded to 'with or without intent to cause distress' as the victim suffers despite intent

attributes.action: more funding for schools to tackle mental health issues in staff and students.
attributes.background: We want schools to gain more access to mental health facilities that can greatly benefit their staff and students. Many people suffer in silence because of the lack of support that they can get, we want to change this to make sure that nobody suffers alone. This may include onsite counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health can change the way in which you take in information and how you perform in your daily life. This can affect the way that staff will teach and how the students make progress in their examinations. Mental health issues can often lead to you not doing mandatory things such as eating and getting enough sleep, these are very important factors needed to continue a healthy lifestyle.

attributes.action: Keep the Panavia Tornado in service for another few years
attributes.background: The Tornado is one of the most capable and advanced strike aircraft currently fielded by any air force today, and RAF Tornados are currently conducting airstrikes on insurgents in the Middle East, and the Tornado will be kept in service by Germany until 2025, so why can’t we?

attributes.action: Stop the use of Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (child spies).
attributes.background: Currently Juvenile CHIS (child spies) can be used to gather information to do with offences such as gang violence, drug offences and child sexual exploitation. They can be authorised for covert activity for up to one month which the government is trying to increase to 4 months.
attributes.additional_details: The Home office has given no numbers of how many child spies are used, how the risk assessments are carried out and whether the handlers are trained to assess juvenile mental health. The capacity for children to consent to being spies is dubious given they must feel under pressure from an authority figure (the police force) and are vulnerable in a dangerous situation. Refer to 35th Report of Session 2017-2019 of the House of Lords Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee.

attributes.action: Create an independent enquiry to determine if foreign powers influenced Brexit.
attributes.background: With allegations of Russian interference in elections in other countries and elements of the Leave campaign facing allegations of violating spending rules that may have influenced the narrow outcome of the referendum, citizens have a right to know if Brexit truly is the will of the British people.
attributes.additional_details: It's everywhere in respected media outlets as well as American intelligence reports.

attributes.action: Increase the funding and support for the production of shale gas by fracking
attributes.background:
Fracking has the potential to boost the UK economy. It will increase job opportunities, lower imported fuel, whilst bringing a higher tax revenue with greater energy security.

The production of shale gas would reduce volatility within the wholesale market.
attributes.additional_details:
Local communities would see significant benefits from fracking economically with an increase of job opportunities. The first 100 sites could create 74,000 jobs.

Local communities which host sites will also be rewarded more directly. In June 2013, UKOOG announced its first industry-wide community benefits scheme where the local community will benefit to the sum of £100,000.

The industry estimates that it could add up to over £1.1bn in a 25 year period or about £5m to £10m per site.

attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: Re-skill ALL shop floor workers who have been made redundant in 2018 onwards.
attributes.background: Around 30,000 jobs have been lost or at risk since Jan 1 2018. The British Retail Consortium are predicting that up to 1m jobs could be lost or at risk by 2020 in UK Retailing. Every shop worker should be given FREE training to start a new digital career in online retailing.

attributes.action: Change CMS from GROSS pay back to NET pay and don't include a fathers overtime.
attributes.background: The child support agency (CSA) has changed over to the child maintainance service (CMS) and in doing so it has changed calculations from NET PAY to GROSS PAY costing dads anywhere from £50 extra per month to 200+ extra per month, as these new calculations also include overtime.
attributes.additional_details: Also take into account the mental state this can have on a father. We are trying to prevent problems, not create more.

attributes.action: Make dementia training mandatory within the NHS and hospitals.
attributes.background: Help me change how people living with dementia can have a better quality of care when visiting the hospital and being treated by staff with very little or no experience and  knowledge of the disease and also help the staff to better their knowledge and understanding of dementia.
attributes.additional_details: Elderly lady living with dementia in a care home setting had a fall as was taken to A & E due to NHS staff ( GP's, OT's, Radiographers and nurses ) lack of understanding and knowledge of dementia. She was sedated unnecessarily as they said she was a risk to herself.

attributes.action: Make high blood pressure tablets free on the NHS
attributes.background: Over 5 million people have high blood pressure and it affects more than 1 in 4 adults and is one of the biggest risk factors for premature death and disability in England.High blood pressure can lead to diseases including heart disease, stroke, vascular dementia and chronic kidney disease.
attributes.additional_details: People who treat their diabetes with tablets, injection therapies or insulin are entitled to free prescriptions – but if you're in England you'll need to have a medical exemption certificate to claim your free prescription unless you're aged 60 or over. High blood pressure affects more people and have the same potential to kill a sufferer as someone with diabetes. High blood pressure sufferers right across the UK should be treated equally and fairly as diabetics and get free medication

attributes.action: Scrap the 2 child limit on the benefits system
attributes.background: Limiting the children in the benefit system to 2 only. is causing unfair hardship on families.Some single mothers have absent fathers. who if forced to pay out benefits can pay as little as £1.50 pw, with no government help. how can this be fair upon the child they abandoned..
